title.narrative: Breaking the cycle of poverty by improving & develop fishing community

description.narrative:
Somalia’s extremely rich fishery resources are heavily under-exploited due to the consequences of political instability and to limited skills, equipment and market infrastructure in the local fishing communities. Youth and women are not fully involved in the fishing sector and the know-how from the older generation risks being dispersed. This situation severely limits the chances of generating sustainable income and employment, in a context of poverty and vulnerability.
The Project will carry out research and consultation within coastal communities involved in artisanal fishing, in order to generate much-needed data on fisheries’ potential and challenges, from the points of view of both supply and demand. The information will be used to design business models and organisational arrangements that would allow the local communities to fish, process and trade within their region in a more efficient and equitable manner.
Local communities will therefore access crucial information that will enable them to plan appropriate support for sustainable economic activities. The outcomes of the research will be shared with potential donors, investors, local government and other key stakeholders, in order to mobilise resources for a fully-fledged project in this sector as well as to inform and improve local policy on fisheries development.
